verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च |
एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ||१३-१||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva kṣetraṃ kṣetrajñameva ca .
etadveditumicchāmi jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ ca keśava ..13-1..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
1. PRAKRITI (Matter) and PURUSHA (Spirit) , also the KSHETRA (the Field) and KSHETRAJNA (the Knower-of-the-Field) , Knowledge and that which ought to be known --- these, I wish to learn, O Keshava.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते |
एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ||१३-२||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
idaṃ śarīraṃ kaunteya kṣetramityabhidhīyate .
etadyo vetti taṃ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tadvidaḥ ..13-2..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
2. This body, O Kaunteya is called KSHETRA (the Field) and he who knows it is called KSHETRAJNA (the Knower-of-the-Field) by those who know them (KSHETRA and KSHETRAJNA) i. e. by the sages .

verses.hn:
क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत |
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ||१३-३||
verses.en:
kṣetrajñaṃ cāpi māṃ viddhi sarvakṣetreṣu bhārata .
kṣetrakṣetrajñayorjñānaṃ yattajjñānaṃ mataṃ mama ..13-3..
verses.desc: 3. Know Me as the "Knower-of-the-Field" in all "Fields, " O Bharata; Knowledge of the "Field" as also of the "knower-of-the-Field" is considered by Me to be My Knowledge.

verses.hn:
तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् |
स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ||१३-४||
verses.en:
tatkṣetraṃ yacca yādṛkca yadvikāri yataśca yat .
sa ca yo yatprabhāvaśca tatsamāsena me śṛṇu ..13-4..
verses.desc: 4. What that Field is; of what nature it is; what are its modifications; whence it is; and also who He is; and what His powers are --- these hear from Me in brief.

verses.hn:
ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् |
ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ||१३-५||
verses.en:
ṛṣibhirbahudhā gītaṃ chandobhirvividhaiḥ pṛthak .
brahmasūtrapadaiścaiva hetumadbhirviniścitaiḥ ..13-5..
verses.desc:
5. RISHIS have sung (about the "Field" and the "Knower-of-the-Field" ) in many ways,
in various distinctive chants and also in the suggestive words indicative of BRAHMAN,
full of reason and decision.

verses.hn:
महाभूतान्यहंकारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च |
इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ||१३-६||
verses.en:
mahābhūtānyahaṃkāro buddhiravyaktameva ca .
indriyāṇi daśaikaṃ ca pañca cendriyagocarāḥ ..13-6..
verses.desc:
6. The great elements, egoism, intellect, and also the unmanifested (MOOLA-PRAKRITI)
, the ten senses and the one (the mind) and the five objects-of-the-senses, . . .

verses.hn:
इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः |
एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ||१३-७||
verses.en:
icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ saṃghātaścetanā dhṛtiḥ .
etatkṣetraṃ samāsena savikāramudāhṛtam ..13-7..
verses.desc:
7. Desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, aggregate (body) , intelligence, fortitude --- this
KSHETRA has been thus briefly described with its modifications.

verses.hn:
अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् |
आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ||१३-८||
verses.en:
amānitvamadambhitvamahiṃsā kṣāntirārjavam .
ācāryopāsanaṃ śaucaṃ sthairyamātmavinigrahaḥ ..13-8..
verses.desc:
8. Humility, unpretentiousness, non-injury, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the
teacher, purity, steadfastness, self-control . . .

verses.hn:
इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहंकार एव च |
जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ||१३-९||
verses.en:
indriyārtheṣu vairāgyamanahaṃkāra eva ca .
janmamṛtyujarāvyādhiduḥkhadoṣānudarśanam ..13-9..
verses.desc:
9. Indifference to the objects of the sense, and also absence of egoism, perception of (or
reflection upon) evils in birth, death, old age, sickness and pain. . .

verses.hn:
असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु |
नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ||१३-१०||
verses.en:
asaktiranabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putradāragṛhādiṣu .
nityaṃ ca samacittatvamiṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu ..13-10..
verses.desc:
10. Non-attachment; non-identification of Self with son, wife, home and the rest; and
constant even-mindedness on the attainment of the desirable and the undesirable. . .

verses.hn:
मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी |
विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ||१३-११||
verses.en:
mayi cānanyayogena bhaktiravyabhicāriṇī .
viviktadeśasevitvamaratirjanasaṃsadi ..13-11..
verses.desc:
11. Unswerving devotion unto Me by the YOGA of non-separation, resorting to solitary
places, distaste for the society of men. . .

verses.hn:
अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् |
एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ||१३-१२||
verses.en:
adhyātmajñānanityatvaṃ tattvajñānārthadarśanam .
etajjñānamiti proktamajñānaṃ yadato.anyathā ..13-12..
verses.desc:
12. Constancy in Self-knowledge, perception of the end of true knowledge --- this is
declared to be "knowledge, " and what is opposed to it is "ignorance. "

verses.hn:
ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते |
अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ||१३-१३||
verses.en:
jñeyaṃ yattatpravakṣyāmi yajjñātvāmṛtamaśnute .
anādi matparaṃ brahma na sattannāsaducyate ..13-13..
verses.desc:
13. I will declare that which has to be "known" knowing which one attains to
Immortality --- the beginningless Supreme BRAHMAN, called neither being nor non-
being.

verses.hn:
सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् |
सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ||१३-१४||
verses.en:
sarvataḥ pāṇipādaṃ tatsarvato.akṣiśiromukham .
sarvataḥ śrutimalloke sarvamāvṛtya tiṣṭhati ..13-14..
verses.desc:
14. With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads and mouths everywhere, with ears
everywhere, He exists in the world, enveloping all.

verses.hn:
सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् |
असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ||१३-१५||
verses.en:
sarvendriyaguṇābhāsaṃ sarvendriyavivarjitam .
asaktaṃ sarvabhṛccaiva nirguṇaṃ guṇabhoktṛ ca ..13-15..
verses.desc:
15. Shining by the functions of all the senses, yet without the senses; unattached, yet
supporting all; devoid of qualities, yet their experiencer. . .

verses.hn:
बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च |
सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ||१३-१६||
verses.en:
bahirantaśca bhūtānāmacaraṃ carameva ca .
sūkṣmatvāttadavijñeyaṃ dūrasthaṃ cāntike ca tat ..13-16..
verses.desc:
16. Without and within (all) beings, the 'unmoving' and also the 'moving' ; because of its
subtlety unknowable; and near and far away --- is That.

verses.hn:
अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् |
भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ||१३-१७||
verses.en:
avibhaktaṃ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktamiva ca sthitam .
bhūtabhartṛ ca tajjñeyaṃ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca ..13-17..
verses.desc:
17. And undivided, yet He exists as if divided in beings; That is to be known as the
Supporter of Beings; He devours and He generates.

verses.hn:
ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते |
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ||१३-१८||
verses.en:
jyotiṣāmapi tajjyotistamasaḥ paramucyate .
jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ jñānagamyaṃ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam ..13-18..
verses.desc:
18. That (BRAHMAN) , the Light-of-all lights, is said to be beyond darkness; (It is)
Knowledge, the Object-of-Knowledge, seated in the hearts of all, to be reached by Knowledge.

verses.hn:
इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः |
मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ||१३-१९||
verses.en:
iti kṣetraṃ tathā jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ coktaṃ samāsataḥ .
madbhakta etadvijñāya madbhāvāyopapadyate ..13-19..
verses.desc:
19. Thus the Field, as well as the knowledge and the knowable have been briefly stated.
Knowing this, My devotee enters into My Being.

verses.hn:
प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि |
विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ||१३-२०||
verses.en:
prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva viddhyanādi ubhāvapi .
vikārāṃśca guṇāṃścaiva viddhi prakṛtisambhavān ..13-20..
verses.desc:
20. Know you that Matter (PRAKRITI) and Spirit (PURUSHA) are both beginningless;
and know you also that all modifications and qualities are born of PRAKRITI.

verses.hn:
कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते |
पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ||१३-२१||
verses.en:
kāryakāraṇakartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtirucyate .
puruṣaḥ sukhaduḥkhānāṃ bhoktṛtve heturucyate ..13-21..
verses.desc: 21. In the production of the effect and the cause, PRAKRITI is said to be the cause; in the experience of pleasure and pain, PURUSHA is said to be the cause.

verses.hn:
पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् |
कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ||१३-२२||
verses.en:
puruṣaḥ prakṛtistho hi bhuṅkte prakṛtijānguṇān .
kāraṇaṃ guṇasaṅgo.asya sadasadyonijanmasu ..13-22..
verses.desc:
22. The PURUSHA, seated in PRAKRITI, experiences the qualities born of PRAKRITI;
attachment to the qualities is the cause of his birth in good and evil wombs.

verses.hn:
उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः |
परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ||१३-२३||
verses.en:
upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ .
paramātmeti cāpyukto dehe.asminpuruṣaḥ paraḥ ..13-23..
verses.desc:
23. The supreme PURUSHA in this body is also called the Spectator, the Permitter, the
Supporter, the Enjoyer, the great Lord and the Supreme Self.

verses.hn:
य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह |
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ||१३-२४||
verses.en:
ya evaṃ vetti puruṣaṃ prakṛtiṃ ca guṇaiḥ saha .
sarvathā vartamāno.api na sa bhūyo.abhijāyate ..13-24..
verses.desc:
24. He who thus knows the PURUSHA and PRAKRITI together with the qualities, in
whatsoever condition he may be, he is not born again.

verses.hn:
ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना |
अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ||१३-२५||
verses.en:
dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecidātmānamātmanā .
anye sāṅkhyena yogena karmayogena cāpare ..13-25..
verses.desc:
25. Some, by meditation, behold the Self in the Self by the Self; others by the "YOGA -of-
Knowledge" (by SANKHYA YOGA) ; and others by KARMA YOGA.

verses.hn:
अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते |
तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ||१३-२६||
verses.en:
anye tvevamajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate .
te.api cātitarantyeva mṛtyuṃ śrutiparāyaṇāḥ ..13-26..
verses.desc: 26. Others also, not knowing this, worship, having heard of it from others; they too, cross beyond death, if they would regard what they have heard as their Supreme Refuge.

verses.hn:
यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् |
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ||१३-२७||
verses.en:
yāvatsañjāyate kiñcitsattvaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam .
kṣetrakṣetrajñasaṃyogāttadviddhi bharatarṣabha ..13-27..
verses.desc:
27. Wherever any being is born, the unmoving or the moving, know you, O best of the
Bharatas, that it is from the union between the "Field" and the "Knower-of-the-Field. "

verses.hn:
समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् |
विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||१३-२८||
verses.en:
samaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṃ parameśvaram .
vinaśyatsvavinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ..13-28..
verses.desc:
28. He sees, who sees the Supreme Lord existing equally in all beings, the unperishing
within the perishing.

verses.hn:
समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् |
न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||१३-२९||
verses.en:
samaṃ paśyanhi sarvatra samavasthitamīśvaram .
na hinastyātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim ..13-29..
verses.desc:
29. Indeed, he who sees the same Lord everywhere equally dwelling, destroys not the Self
by the Self; therefore, he goes to the Highest Goal.

verses.hn:
प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः |
यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ||१३-३०||
verses.en:
prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ .
yaḥ paśyati tathātmānamakartāraṃ sa paśyati ..13-30..
verses.desc:
30. He sees, who sees that all actions are performed by PRAKRITI alone, and that the
Self is actionless.

verses.hn:
यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति |
तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ||१३-३१||
verses.en:
yadā bhūtapṛthagbhāvamekasthamanupaśyati .
tata eva ca vistāraṃ brahma sampadyate tadā ..13-31..
verses.desc:
31. When he (man) sees the whole variety-of-beings, as resting in the One, and spreading
forth from That (One) alone, he then becomes BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः |
शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ||१३-३२||
verses.en:
anāditvānnirguṇatvātparamātmāyamavyayaḥ .
śarīrastho.api kaunteya na karoti na lipyate ..13-32..
verses.desc:
32. Being without beginning, and being devoid of qualities, the Supreme Self, the
Imperishable, though dwelling in the body, O Kaunteya, neither acts, nor is tainted.

verses.hn:
यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते |
सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ||१३-३३||
verses.en:
yathā sarvagataṃ saukṣmyādākāśaṃ nopalipyate .
sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate ..13-33..
verses.desc:
33. As the all-pervading ether is not tainted, because of its subtlety, so too the Self, seated
everywhere in the body, is not tainted.

verses.hn:
यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः |
क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ||१३-३४||
verses.en:
yathā prakāśayatyekaḥ kṛtsnaṃ lokamimaṃ raviḥ .
kṣetraṃ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṃ prakāśayati bhārata ..13-34..
verses.desc:
34. Just as the one Sun illumines the whole world, so also the Lord-of-the-Field
(PARAMATMAN) illumines the whole "Field, " O Bharata.

verses.hn:
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा |
भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ||१३-३५||
verses.en:
kṣetrakṣetrajñayorevamantaraṃ jñānacakṣuṣā .
bhūtaprakṛtimokṣaṃ ca ye viduryānti te param ..13-35..
verses.desc:
35. They who, with their eye-of-wisdom come to know the distinction between the "Field"
and the "Knower-of-the-Field", and of the liberation from the "PRAKRITI" of the being, go to the Supreme.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञविभागयोगो नाम त्रयोदशोऽध्यायः ||१३||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde kṣetrakṣetrajñavibhāgayogo nāma trayodaśo.adhyāyaḥ ..13-36..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the thirteenth discourse ends entitled:
THE FIELD AND THE KNOWER-OF-THE-FIELD
